creator: ajstarks@comcast.net
text:
When running batik-based applications like squggle under Mac OS X (10.2.6)
with the Apple-supplied JVM:

java version "1.4.1_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_01-69.1)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_01-24, mixed mode)


Font metrics errors are thrown at startup:

2003-09-20 08:34:56.221 java[592] Font GB18030Bitmap: in
_readBasicMetricsForSize, claims 0 max advance but is fixed-pitch.
2003-09-20 08:35:01.158 java[592] Warning: Font LucidaSans-TypewriterBold claims
fixed-pitch with 0 max advance!
2003-09-20 08:35:06.470 java[592] Warning: Font LucidaSans-TypewriterBold claims
fixed-pitch with 0 max advance!
2003-09-20 08:35:14.900 java[592] Font GB18030Bitmap: in
_readBasicMetricsForSize, claims 0 max advance but is fixed-pitch.
2003-09-20 08:35:18.391 java[592] Font GB18030Bitmap: in
_readBasicMetricsForSize, claims 0 max advance but is fixed-pitch.
      2003-09-20 08:35:28.903 java[592] Font GB18030Bitmap: in
_readBasicMetricsForSize, claims 0 max advance but is fixed-pitch.


Note that by switching to the older JVM, 1.3.1, this problem does not occur.

Created attachment 8508
Small standalone test that demonstraights problem with Mac OS JVM.
creator: deweese@apache.org
deweese@apache.org
text: This is fixed in the Panther JVM
